00034 /** @file decl.h
00035     @brief Declarations related to type declarations; the parser basically
00036     creates instances of these classes, which are then turned into actual
00037     Types.
00038 
00039     Three classes work together to represent declarations.  As an example,
00040     consider a declaration like:
00041 
00042     static uniform int foo, bar[10];
00043 
00044     An instance of the Declaration class represents this entire declaration
00045     of two variables, 'foo' and 'bar'.  It holds a single instance of the
00046     DeclSpecs class represents the common specifiers for all of the
00047     variables--here, that the declaration has the 'static' and 'uniform'
00048     qualifiers, and that it's basic type is 'int'.  Then for each variable
00049     declaration, the Declaraiton class holds an instance of a Declarator,
00050     which in turn records the per-variable information like the symbol
00051     name, array size (if any), initializer expression, etc.
00052 */
00053 
00054 #ifndef ISPC_DECL_H
00055 #define ISPC_DECL_H
00056 
00057 #include "ispc.h"
00058 
00059 struct VariableDeclaration;
00060 
00061 class Declaration;
00062 class Declarator;
00063 
00064 enum StorageClass {
00065     SC_NONE,
00066     SC_EXTERN,
00067     SC_EXPORT,
00068     SC_STATIC,
00069     SC_TYPEDEF,
00070     SC_EXTERN_C
00071 };
00072 
00073 
00074 /* Multiple qualifiers can be provided with types in declarations;
00075    therefore, they are set up so that they can be ANDed together into an
00076    int. */
00077 #define TYPEQUAL_NONE           0
00078 #define TYPEQUAL_CONST      (1<<0)
00079 #define TYPEQUAL_UNIFORM    (1<<1)
00080 #define TYPEQUAL_VARYING    (1<<2)
00081 #define TYPEQUAL_TASK       (1<<3)
00082 #define TYPEQUAL_REFERENCE  (1<<4)
00083 #define TYPEQUAL_UNSIGNED   (1<<5)
00084 #define TYPEQUAL_INLINE     (1<<6)
00085 
00086 /** @brief Representation of the declaration specifiers in a declaration.
00087 
00088     In other words, this represents all of the stuff that applies to all of
00089     the (possibly multiple) variables in a declaration.
00090  */
00091 class DeclSpecs {
00092 public:
00093     DeclSpecs(const Type *t = NULL, StorageClass sc = SC_NONE, int tq = TYPEQUAL_NONE);
00094 
00095     void Print() const;
00096 
00097     StorageClass storageClass;
00098 
00099     /** Zero or more of the TYPEQUAL_* values, ANDed together. */
00100     int typeQualifier;
00101 
00102     /** The basic type provided in the declaration; this should be an
00103         AtomicType, a StructType, or a VectorType; other types (like
00104         ArrayTypes) will end up being created if a particular declaration
00105         has an array size, etc.
00106     */
00107     const Type *baseType;
00108 
00109     /** If this is a declaration with a vector type, this gives the vector
00110         width.  For non-vector types, this is zero.
00111      */
00112     int vectorSize;
00113 
00114     /** If this is a declaration with an "soa<n>" qualifier, this gives the
00115         SOA width specified.  Otherwise this is zero.
00116      */
00117     int soaWidth;
00118 };
00119 
00120 
00121 /** @brief Representation of the declaration of a single variable.  
00122 
00123     In conjunction with an instance of the DeclSpecs, this gives us
00124     everything we need for a full variable declaration.
00125  */
00126 class Declarator {
00127 public:
00128     Declarator(Symbol *s, SourcePos p);
00129 
00130     /** As the parser peels off array dimension declarations after the
00131         symbol name, it calls this method to provide them to the
00132         Declarator.
00133      */
00134     void AddArrayDimension(int size);
00135 
00136     /** Once a DeclSpecs instance is available, this method completes the
00137         initialization of the Symbol, setting its Type accordingly.
00138      */
00139     void InitFromDeclSpecs(DeclSpecs *ds);
00140 
00141     /** Get the actual type of the combination of Declarator and the given
00142         DeclSpecs */
00143     const Type *GetType(DeclSpecs *ds) const;
00144 
00145     void GetFunctionInfo(DeclSpecs *ds, Symbol **sym, 
00146                          std::vector<Symbol *> *args);
00147 
00148     void Print() const;
00149 
00150     const SourcePos pos;
00151     Symbol *sym;
00152     /** If this declarator includes an array specification, the sizes of
00153         the array dimensions are represented here.
00154      */
00155     std::vector<int> arraySize;
00156     /** Initialization expression for the variable.  May be NULL. */
00157     Expr *initExpr;
00158     bool isFunction;
00159     std::vector<Declaration *> *functionArgs;
00160 };
00161 
00162 
00163 /** @brief Representation of a full declaration of one or more variables,
00164     including the shared DeclSpecs as well as the per-variable Declarators.
00165  */
00166 class Declaration {
00167 public:
00168     Declaration(DeclSpecs *ds, std::vector<Declarator *> *dlist = NULL);
00169     Declaration(DeclSpecs *ds, Declarator *d);
00170 
00171     void Print() const;
00172 
00173     std::vector<VariableDeclaration> GetVariableDeclarations() const;
00174 
00175     DeclSpecs *declSpecs;
00176     std::vector<Declarator *> declarators;
00177 };
00178 
00179 
00180 /** The parser creates instances of StructDeclaration for the members of
00181     structs as it's parsing their declarations. */
00182 struct StructDeclaration {
00183     StructDeclaration(const Type *t, std::vector<Declarator *> *d)
00184         : type(t), declarators(d) { }
00185 
00186     const Type *type;
00187     std::vector<Declarator *> *declarators;
00188 };
00189 
00190 
00191 /** Given a set of StructDeclaration instances, this returns the types of
00192     the elements of the corresponding struct and their names. */
00193 extern void GetStructTypesNamesPositions(const std::vector<StructDeclaration *> &sd,
00194                                          std::vector<const Type *> *elementTypes,
00195                                          std::vector<std::string> *elementNames,
00196                                          std::vector<SourcePos> *elementPositions);

00198 #endif // ISPC_DECL_H
